definition: matchmaker/go-between/same as 月下老人[yue4 xia4 lao3 ren2]

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
good karma/opportune connection with marriage partner
to pull strings/to manipulate (a puppet)/to control from behind the scene/to mediate
a marriage predestined in a former life (idiom)
to act as go-between (between prospective marriage partners etc)
magpie bridge across the Milky Way between Altair and Vega where Cowherd and Weaving maid 牛郎織女|牛郎织女 are allowed an annual meeting
luck with the ladies/a romance/good luck
to have luck with the ladies (idiom)
to make a wish/to make a vow/to promise a reward
